thread.title: Everton had bid turned down for Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney in January
thread.title_full: Everton had bid turned down for Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney in January

author: leeastley
title: Everton had bid turned down for Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney in January
text:
Toffees want Roo Everton had bid turned down for Manchester United striker Wayne Rooney in January 
The Toffees made an audacious attempt to re-sign their former player but United knocked the offer back By LEE ASTLEY Comments EVERTON had a cheeky bid for Manchester United star Wayne Rooney turned down in January. 
The Toffees logged an offer for their former player last month only for United to turn the deal away. PA:Press Association 3 Everton attempted to buy Wayne Rooney in January but their bid was turned down by United related stories NEIL CUSTIS Wayne Rooney may have turned down China move but his Man United days are numbered... and the statement told you something was up IAN WRIGHT Man Utd fans should show Wayne Rooney some love... he's done unbelievable things there Rooney to stay Wayne Rooney confirms he has rejected mega-money offers from Chinese clubs and is staying at Man United ROO ARE THEY? Who are Tianjin Quanjian? Wayne Rooney in talks over move to Chinese Super League side from Manchester United DON'T DO IT Carlton Palmer warns Wayne Rooney against China move... after spending last three years in Shanghai Getty Images 3 Wayne Rooney was offered £1million-a-week to move to China 
Rooney said: “Despite the interest which has been shown from other clubs, for which I’m grateful, I want to end recent speculation and say that I am staying at Manchester United. 
“I hope I will play a full part in helping the team in its fight for success on four fronts. It’s an exciting time at the club and I want to remain a part of it.”
